text: from the shores of bodrum the hope of
Europe burns bright the majority of the
refugees are Syrian but several other
nationalities are here too waiting for
their chance to flee so this is bucket
here some have already tried and failed
Omar and his brother bucker from Iraq
boarded a boat last week it capsized and
he lost bucket every day he and his
parents search but no sign with our
combination etc we had lifejackets the
smuggler told us he would hand them to
us but when we were on board he threw
them away he didn't want to leave any
trace if he sank and died when we
capsized I just wanted to get my brother
to safety I wish I was the one dead and
that he still alive for his mother the
unbearable state of not knowing and
perhaps she never will but Korean she
had noble beards buckler was the
sweetest of all of us smart and handsome
this is a test from God but such a hard
test can you imagine losing the most
precious thing you have I'll stay here
until I find him
in Central bodrum the nationalities come
together for shelter among them a
Pakistani couple they sold their home to
pay the smuggler who's disappeared with
their money she is due to give birth in
a week our doll has odd it took us one
month to reach here and the man ran away
with our two thousand dollars we're
stuck here and we don't have any medical
care for the delivery of the baby all we
want is to go to Europe for a better
future for our children what a contrast
now between the thousands of happy
relieved refugees arriving in Germany
and those here at the start of their
journey daunted by the path ahead unless
they can navigate the smugglers and the
rough seas towards Greece they may never
actually make it their hopes and dreams
of Europe will go unfulfilled the many
faces of the refugee crisis united by
their aim but also by despair
